message: dedicated databases are a process just like anything else
Is Redis considered a database by that standard?
On the new pricing page, you say that "Databases are shared and not considered to be processes — they are just charged for the disk space they use."
Ah. So I assume that Postgres will be charged merely by the GB-month, unless you get a dedicated DB server.
That paragraph is something of a lie - we'll offer very small (~16MB) redis databases for free under the shared plan, and then bigger ones will come under the dedicated database server plan
What about CouchDB and MongoDB? Will you offer shared options for them, or would they only be available as dedicated DBs?
Yep - that's how Postgres will work. We haven't looked into other databases yet, but hopefully there will be a way of providing a shared option.

Another question. When you say, "Each app comes with [...] 5GB of free bandwidth and 2GB of free disk space," is that per-month, or total before you have to start paying? And by GB of free disk space, do you actually mean GB-month?
